wikipedia_page.main: Patrick McKenna (9 August 1868 – 7 February 1942) was a Catholic Bishop of Clogher in Ireland.

response: When Patrick McKenna, Catholic Bishop of Clogher, presented the McKenna Cup to the Ulster Council in 1925, he was one of only a small group willing at that time to be publicly associated with the GAA in Ulster. Ireland in the 1920s was slowly emerging from war, unrest and change.

He was appointed the Roman Catholic Bishop of Clogher in Ireland on 30 January 1943, following the death of Dr. Patrick McKenna, on 7 February 1942 and received episcopal consecration on 4 April 1943.Bishop Eugene O'Callaghan profile at Catholic Hierarchy website. Retrieved 2 July 2018. His Episcopal Motto was Ad Jesum per Mariam (To Jesus through Mary.)
He died in office in 1909 having served as bishop of his diocese for almost fifteen years. Owens was succeeded by as bishop by Patrick McKenna.
*9 August – Patrick McKenna, Roman Catholic Bishop of Clogher, 1909–1942 (died 1942).
Patrick McKenna (born 1960) is a Canadian actor.
Patrick McKenna may also refer to:
* Patrick McKenna (Ingenious Media) (born 1956), chief executive of Ingenious Media
* Patrick McKenna (bishop) (1868–1942), Roman Catholic Bishop of Clogher in Ireland
* Patrick McKenna (Irish politician), Irish politician and farmer
* Patrick McKenna, a character in the film Angels & Demons
* Patrick McKenna (baseball) (1854–1922), Major League Baseball center fielder
* Patrick McKenna, informer for the Great Train Robbery in 1963
